mixed-citation.article-title: Acroterius gen. nov. (Araneae: Linyphiidae: Linyphiinae) with twelve new species from Yunnan, China

tp:taxon-treatment.tp:nomenclature:
Acroterius absentus
gen. et sp. nov.

tp:treatment-sec.p:
The new species can be distinguished from all other species of
Acroterius
gen. nov. by the absence of radical apophysis ( Figs 1A–C , 3A–B ).
The species name comes from the Latin adjective ‘ absens ’, meaning ‘absent’, referring to the radical apophysis absent in male palp.

Holotype CHINA • ♂ ; Yunnan Province , Baoshan City , Nankang Yakou ( National 320 Road ); 24.43717° N , 98.46054° E ; alt.
2186 m

PALP ( Figs 1A–D , 3A–B ). Paracymbium highly sclerotized, distal part with three projections ( Figs 1B , 3B ), lateral projection small, triangular; median projection broad, tongue-shaped and ventral projection thumb-like ( Figs 1B , 3B ); the distal suprategular apophysis robust with pointed end ( Figs 1A–C , 3A–B ); radical apophysis absent ( Figs 1A–C , 3A–B ). Embolus originating from distal serrated part of radix, stout, short with pointed end ( Figs 1A–C , 3A–B ).
